;新加坡出生的喜剧演员关于失踪的马来西亚航空公司 MH370 的笑话引发的强烈抗议星期四，随着这个城市国家驻吉隆坡的高级专员发表道歉，两国的外交部长都参与进来，表演者似乎已经停用了几个社交媒体页面。

;

;在星期四午夜刚过的一份声明中，高级专员 Vanu Gopala Menon 向所有马来西亚人道歉，因为 Jocelyn Chia 在纽约一家喜剧俱乐部制作的小品中发表了“伤人言论”，并在她的 TikTok 和 Instagram 帐户上分享。

;

;称有关言论失踪的客机以及 Chia 对马来西亚的其他评论“无端冒犯”，Menon 澄清说她不再是新加坡公民，她发表的评论不反映城邦的观点。

;

;“新加坡政府不会容忍对他人造成伤害或伤害的言行，而不再是新加坡人的 Chia 也不会以任何方式反映我们的观点，”他说。

;

;'这个笑话要命' : 新加坡喜剧演员用 MH370 搞笑激怒了马来西亚

;

;在她的小品 Chia 中，一位前律师转型的喜剧演员告诉纽约喜剧酒窖俱乐部的观众，新加坡在 1965 年与马来西亚分离后克服了困难，并出现了作为短暂的两年工会中更成功的合作伙伴，称其为“最好的分手报复”。

;

;她将节目献给新加坡首任总理李光耀，“没有他，新加坡就不会

;

;马来西亚人和新加坡人就他们在语言、文化和食物方面的共同异同开玩笑。

;

;但是 Chia 关于 MH370 的下流笑话激起了全国的愤怒马来西亚的社交媒体，在许多人眼中越过了正派的界限。

;

;她的 Twitter 帐户已被暂停，而且她似乎已经删除了托管违规视频的 Instagram 帐户。她的 TikTok 帐户仍然在线，视频是她的最新帖子。

;

;该短剧早些时候引起了马来西亚外交部的注意，该部发表声明抨击 Chia 的评论，称其公然缺乏敏感性和同理心马来西亚人和飞机之谜的受害者。

;

;“我希望任何形式的行动或尝试都可以停止，以确保继续尊重任何国家，”外交部长 Zambry Abd Kadir 说.

;

;他的新加坡外长维维安·巴拉克里希南（Vivian Balakrishnan）为造成的冒犯道歉，他说他对这些笑话“感到震惊”。

;

;“她当然不代表新加坡人说话，我们珍惜我们与马来西亚的家人和朋友，”他在推特上写道。

;

;“需求高涨”：随着林吉特暴跌，新加坡人希望前往马来西亚旅行更便宜

;

;关于高级专员道歉并宣布她是“不再是新加坡人”在马来西亚引起了不解，人们开玩笑说她因为这个笑话而失去了公民身份。

;

;“想象一下，你因为做出麻木不仁的‘分手报复’而失去了你长大的国家的公民身份和你的邻居开玩笑，”一位 Twitter 用户说。

;

;其他人称赞新加坡特使代表 Chia 道歉，特别是因为她不再是公民。

;香港政府对 2 港元（26 美分）交通补贴的贡献经济学家和立法者周四表示，老年人应该每月或每年受到限制，同时还呼吁对滥用者施加更严厉的惩罚，以确保该制度的可持续性。

;

;中国大学刘佐德执行董事张泰良全球经济与金融研究所 (Institute of Global Economics and Finance) 告诉一个广播节目，近年来，针对老年人和残疾通勤者的优惠计划从公共金库中流失了更多资金。

;

;“政府资金应该有一个上限......每个月或每年，”Chong 说。

;

;当局在一天前宣布将于本月在全市范围内开展行动，以打击滥用该计划的行为，铁路巨头港铁公司也将加大处罚力度

;

;劳工及福利局局长孙玉涵早前透露，政府在该计划下向公共交通营办商发还的金额，从大约港币2018-19 财年的 12 亿澳元增加到 2022-23 财年的近 31 亿港元，当时该计划扩大到涵盖 60 岁以上的居民——而不是原来的 65 岁及以上门槛。

;

; 2023-24 年的估计成本为 67 亿港元。

;

;香港地铁将对滥用 2 港元票价计划的行为处以罚款，并正在采取行动打击

;

;Chong 周四辩称，优惠票价应该是与票价挂钩，而不是 2 港元的固定价格。

;

;“如果票价较高，人们应该支付更多费用，而不是固定价格，”他建议道，并补充说政府没有盈余

;

;前九广铁路公司主席田北新立法会议员曾呼吁政府考虑给予票价 80% 的折扣

;

;政府早前预测，香港的金库将在 2023-24 年保持赤字，赤字将达 544 亿港元

;

;Tony Tse Wai-chuen代表建筑、测量、规划和园林界的立法会议员，在同一个电台节目中表示，尽管港铁公司已经计划实施更严厉的罚款，但仍应实施更严厉的处罚。

;

;从 6 月 25 日开始，对人们的处罚滥用优惠计划的重轨服务将从 500 港元增加到 1,000 港元，轻轨将从 290 港元增加到 370 港元。

;

;“为了加强威慑，罚款可能会更高，”Tse争论。 “如果处罚更重，即使工作人员只能进行抽查，人们也会担心被抓到。”

;

;将审查香港长者交通计划下的通勤支出：John Lee

;

; Tse 和 Chong 还敦促政府利用技术解决乘客乘坐长途巴士路线进行短途旅行的问题，这种做法可能会让政府付出更多代价。

;

;以韩国首都首尔为例例如，Chong 表示，旅客在上下车时需要刷卡，并根据行驶距离收费。

;

;“技术就在这里。这取决于政府是否希望公交运营商实施它，”他说。

; Thu, 08 Jun 2023 11:50:02 +0800 ‘Don’t let him drink too much’: online praise as caring Chinese daughter enters boozy father’s chat group, urges friends to limit his alcohol intakehttps://www.scmp.com/news/people-culture/trending-china/article/3223109/dont-let-him-drink-too-much-online-praise-caring-chinese-daughter-enters-boozy-fathers-chat-group?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.08 11:00;
;;

;一个有爱心的中国女儿，在与酗酒的父亲的束缚中走投无路，给酒友们写了一封发自内心的在线信件，恳求他们“不要和他一起喝酒”。

;

;来自中国东部浙江省的这位姓应的忧心忡忡的大学生将这封信发布在她父亲的朋友圈微信公众号，5月11日晚。

;

;在信中，她讲述了去年看到父亲在另一个社交媒体平台抖音上发布他腿部严重受伤的视频时，她是多么的难过。

;

;她写道，当得知他喝多了酒并在回家的路上从自行车上摔下来受伤时，她充满了“痛苦和悔恨”。

;

;Ying 继续说道她说，这只是她父亲酒后发生的多次泼洒事件之一——最近一次是在她寄出她的信之前，当时他“全身受伤”回家——并补充说，她和她的家人都很担心他的父亲安全和健康。

;

;“爸爸快50岁了，他不再是个年轻人了，不能再像以前那样对付酒精了。他有两个还在上学的孩子、年迈的父母和每天为他操心的妻子。他需要承担起自己的责任，”她写道。

;

;Ying 恳求她父亲的朋友“不要强迫或纵容他喝酒”，并补充说他的酒量不超过两和- 半杯白酒。

;

;在信的最后，英还要求他们鼓励她的父亲参加“良好的娱乐活动”，例如爬山和喝茶，然后祝他的父亲

;

;Ying说她也担心她的父亲，一个固执的人，会因为她的干预而生气。

;

;相反，他6 月 2 日，她告诉白鹿视频，“非常感动，从那以后他就没有喝过酒”。他的朋友们也称赞她是个好女儿，并补充说，英的父亲应该听从她的警告。

;

;在大陆社交媒体上，虽然许多人被英的关怀姿态所温暖，但也有人批评她“不负责任”的父亲和中国的饮酒文化。

;

;许多人表示不喜欢被迫狂饮以显示他们对友谊的奉献或一家公司。

;

;“这不是‘文化’，只是一群自我放纵的酗酒者。真正的友谊不需要喝酒来证明它的价值，”一位网友评论道。

;

;Ying 对此表示同意，并在 6 月 4 日发布的微博回复中表示，这封信并没有“切断我父亲的网络”，正如一些人所担心的那样。 “靠酒精维系的关系不是好的，”她写道。

;联邦检察官已通知美国前总统唐纳德特朗普的律师，他是调查的目标一位知情人士周三表示，他对机密材料的处理受到影响，这增加了他在 2024 年竞选白宫时的法律麻烦。

;

;司法部通常会在人们成为目标时通知他们一项调查，让他们有机会在大陪审团面前出示自己的证据。该通知并不一定意味着特朗普将被起诉。

;

;在他的律师与司法部官员会面讨论此案仅两天后，特朗普的法律团队收到通知的消息就浮出水面。

;

;特朗普竞选团队没有立即回应置评请求。无法联系到特朗普在文件案中的律师发表评论。

;

;该知情人士说，周一通知了特朗普的法律团队。代表特朗普的律师戴维·肖恩 (David Schoen) 表示，虽然有一些迹象表明文件调查即将结束，但一个人何时被告知他们是目标的时间不一定能预测何时可能提出指控史蒂夫·班农 (Steve Bannon) 因藐视国会指控而受到刑事审判。

;

;“有时他们会在长期调查开始时发布，有时会在调查结束时发布，”他说。

;< h3>;对于特朗普来说，臃肿的 2024 年共和党竞选指向 2016 年的回归;

;特朗普是 2024 年共和党总统候选人提名的领跑者，他一再将多项调查描述为出于政治动机。

;

;联邦大陪审团一直在调查特朗普在 2021 年离开白宫后保留机密材料的情况。

;

;第二项刑事调查正在调查特朗普及其盟友涉嫌为推翻他 2020 年大选所做的努力输给了民主党人乔·拜登。

;

;负责调查的特别检察官杰克·史密斯的发言人拒绝置评。

;

;调查人员在 2022 年 8 月查获了大约 13,000 份来自特朗普 3 月份的文件。佛罗里达州棕榈滩的 a-Lago 庄园。其中 100 个被标记为机密，尽管特朗普的一位律师此前曾表示所有带有机密标记的记录都已归还。

;

;特朗普为他保留文件进行了辩护，暗示他在他离开时解密了它们是总统。然而，特朗普没有提供这方面的证据，他的律师也没有在法庭文件中提出这一论点。

;

;特朗普是第一位面临刑事指控的现任或前任美国总统，他在 4 月份对重罪表示不认罪因涉嫌伪造与 2016 年总统竞选前支付给色情明星的封口费有关的商业记录而受到指控。

;

;特朗普在离任一年后的 2022 年 1 月交出了 15 箱记录，但联邦官员来到相信他没有归还所有文件。

;

;司法部于 2022 年 5 月向特朗普发出大陪审团传票，要求他归还任何其他带有机密标记的记录，高级官员前往海湖庄园取回材料。

;

;特朗普的律师向联邦调查局和司法部官员翻阅了标记为机密的 38 页，并向他们展示了海湖庄园的一个储藏室，但不允许特工打开任何

;

;特朗普承认他保留了有关伊朗的机密文件的录音：报告

;

;特朗普的一名律师还签署了一份文件，证明所有带有机密标记的记录都已归还给政府– 后来在联邦调查局搜查他的家后证明是假的。

;

;特朗普的法律问题越来越严重。

;

;5 月，曼哈顿联邦法院的陪审团在一项民事诉讼中裁定，特朗普必须支付 500 万美元的赔偿金，用于对前 Elle 杂志专栏作家 E. Jean Carroll 进行性虐待，然后通过称她为骗子来诽谤她。

;

;特朗普还面临佐治亚州一名县检察官的刑事调查，涉及他的努力以挽回他在该州 2020 年选举中的失败。

;

; Thu, 08 Jun 2023 10:20:02 +0800 Japan’s asylum problem: lessons from Sri Lankan detainee’s death ‘still not learnt’, activists sayhttps://www.scmp.com/week-asia/people/article/3223311/japans-asylum-problem-lessons-sri-lankan-detainees-death-still-not-learnt-activists-say?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.08 09:45;
;;

;两年多前，一名斯里兰卡妇女在名古屋的工作人员无视她寻求医疗帮助的请求，活动人士表示，日本似乎没有从这起成为世界各地头条新闻的人权案件中吸取教训。

;

;移民权利活动家，包括寻求庇护者和等待被驱逐的人说，负责处理被拘留者的政府机构仍然没有有效监督，政府和公众对这些男人、女人和儿童中的许多人的困境知之甚少。< /p>;

;2021 年 3 月，33 岁的斯里兰卡妇女 Ratnayake Liyanage Wishma Sandamali 在名古屋出入境管理局去世。在她的姐妹们进行了一场旷日持久的官司之后，该局最终公布了她最后几天的安全录像，显示桑达玛莉从她的铺位上摔倒在地，并恳求两名工作人员的帮助。未经治疗，她在几个小时后死亡。

;

;“非常年轻”：日本签证的变化可能会推动工人移民

;

;在律师和人权团体的压力下，日本移民服务局日本已证实，自 2007 年以来，已有 18 名外国人在全国各地的拘留设施中死亡，其中一些是逃离本国的内战，另一些则因宗教、政治信仰、性别或性取向而受到迫害。

;

;6 月4 日，东京地方法院责令国家政府和东京都政府向一名被控盗窃的尼泊尔男子在被警方拘捕后死亡，其家人将获得赔偿。虽然这项裁决受到欢迎，但法院决定作为赔偿的数字——100 万日元（7,180 美元）——却被广泛认为是对生命损失的嘲笑。

;

;自从 Sandamali 在拘留期间死亡后，一家媒体对当局的行为变得更加了解类似的案件。大阪入国管理局于 5 月 30 日宣布，在得知一名负责检查被拘留者的女医生喝醉后，已展开内部调查。

;

;4 月，法院命令政府支付库尔德男子因在拘留期间遭到移民工作人员殴打而获得 20 万日元的赔偿。

;

;11 月，一名 50 多岁的意大利男子在被驱逐出境前被拒绝临时释放后，在东京的拘留所自杀。< /p>;

;上个月，反对党日本石党成员梅村瑞穗 (Mizuho Umemura) 声称 Sandamali 可能是假装生病，或者她一直在绝食，以便获得批准，这进一步激怒了人权活动家。从移民中心临时释放。第二天，该党将 Umemura 从国会司法事务委员会中解职。

;

;“她在国会的评论真的让我震惊，”律师兼日本人权组织秘书长伊藤和子说.

;

;“不幸的是，我们看到当今日本政治中的这种态度在增长，而歧视和民族主义情绪也在日本的普通民众中增长，”她说。 “攻击少数民族、外国人、女性变得越来越容易。”

;

;困扰日本移民制度的“根本问题”是没有监督机构来确保囚犯的人权得到保护，违法行为得到惩处。 Ito 说，将对这些中心进行适当的调查，并对不法行为进行惩罚。

;

;“这些中心的控制权归司法部所有，但滥用职权的行为并没有停止，因此我们认为需要一个真正独立的机构来监督这些设施，但这并没有发生。”

;

;相比之下，日本似乎正在收紧有关移民的规定，5 月 9 日通过了一项有争议的移民法修订案，使当局更容易驱逐人员，即使他们仍在等待关于难民身份的决定。政府表示，以前的制度被滥用，因为它允许申请人重复上诉；反对者坚称，这将意味着在本国面临迫害风险的人会更快返回。

;

;司法部发言人告诉《亚洲周刊》，司法部网站上提供了日文版的 Sandamali 之死报告。该官员将所有进一步的信息请求转至该网站。

;

;日本难民协会发言人 Shiho Tanaka 表示，关于日本移民设施中虐待被拘留者的报告有所增加过去十年，将其描述为一个“长期存在的问题”。

;

;“移民中心有一种他们需要‘控制’外国人的态度，并且对保护甚至尊重他们的必要性的理解不足。人权，”她说。

;

;Tanaka 说，一群维权律师最近访问了英国，了解类似的拘留中心是如何运作的，并对这些制度的差异感到“惊讶”。

;< p>;“那里的囚犯有很多自由，他们的人权得到保障，但在日本，我们仍然有这种需要控制被拘留者的假设，”她说。

;

;田中说，结构性问题和不足之处意味着，一些被拘留者在等待难民身份申请的决定期间已被关押十年。

;

;日本：现在对外国工人开放，但仍然存在种族主义?

;

;田中认为，国内媒体终于开始关注囚犯因完全可以避免的原因而被虐待和死亡的报道，这是积极的，并表示日本不能忽视这在国外产生的负面宣传他们的国民在这里被拘留期间死亡。但她对日本当局的态度发生有意义的变化持悲观态度。

;“这个问题得到更多媒体报道是件好事，年轻人也越来越意识到这些问题，我希望政府关心这些人，但系统往往无法正常工作，”她说。

;中国技术学院食堂供应的米饭，其中包含一名学生声称的一段疯传视频中的死老鼠头再次引发了人们对中国学校食堂食品安全的担忧。

;

;澎湃新闻报道，中国东南部江西省江西工业职业技术学院一名身份不明的学生在发现老鼠头时感到震惊6 月 1 日，他在用餐时发现了异物。

;在该学生拍摄的一段广为流传的视频中，可以看到他用筷子夹起老鼠头，似乎可以看到牙齿、眼睛和鼻子。< /p>;

;“牙齿，你能看到吗？ ”该学生在视频中说。

;

;该学生将视频分享到网上，并向食堂反映了这件事。针对视频引发的网上猜测，该学院致电当地食品监管部门对食堂进行了食品安全检查。

;

;检查人员评估了该物品并报告说这是一块熟食

;

;

;6月3日，经食堂检查后，学院发布公示，称已清除安全卫生违规行为。

;

;

;有人问：“鸭脖子怎么长牙了？”

;另一人问：“异物也有鼻子和眼睛；我怎么能相信这只是一个脖子？”

;

;奇怪的食品卫生故事经常引起中国公众的注意。去年 12 月，中国西南地区的一名女性自曝用猪粪洗碗后，在内地社交媒体上引起了不同意见。

;

;它是一种先进的智能肿瘤治疗方法，具有临床应用潜力，因为它可以抑制肿瘤生长，促进机体免疫反应，防止癌细胞转移 –据研究人员称，癌细胞同时扩散到身体的另一部分。

;

;

;常规治疗不能完全根除癌细胞，它们可能会损害正常组织。癌症治疗失败的一个主要原因是疾病通过患者的血管和淋巴管广泛转移。

;

;来自中国的研究人员表示，他们有一种解决方案，可以结合多种新策略，同时抑制癌细胞的生长原发肿瘤和肿瘤转移。他们的工作于 5 月 31 日发表在 Small 上，这是一本涵盖纳米和微米尺度科学的同行评审期刊。

;

;

;研究发现，纳米材料可以减少大鼠体内的癌症干细胞，

;

;Shi 和他的团队用靶向剂 LyP-1 肽修饰了聚合物的表面，该肽可以特异性识别并结合在各种类型的肿瘤细胞（尤其是乳腺癌）上异常过度表达的蛋白质。他们说，因此，纳米平台可以导航并找到它的炸弹目标。

;

;然后，纳米颗粒——包括硫化铜 (CuS) 和 DMXAA，一种切割肿瘤血管细胞的药物——被整合到机舱中聚合物作为武器。

; Thu, 08 Jun 2023 09:20:02 +0800 Retirement: some Hong Kong employees dream of it, others dread it, will introducing a statutory age make a difference?https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/society/article/3223312/retirement-some-hong-kong-employees-dream-it-others-dread-it-will-introducing-statutory-age-make?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.08 09:00;

;在关于香港工作场景的两部分系列的第二部分中，邮报审视了关于法定退休年龄是否会通过缓解劳动力短缺和帮助化解社会定时炸弹带来的好处多于坏处的长期争论。阅读第一部分关于办公室安排的未来。

;

;香港出租车司机余广汉并没有忘记他在 55 岁那年感到多么无助和沮丧，不得不从他曾担任物流公司的退休人员担任车队主管 11 年。

;

;“这是公司政策，所以我别无选择。但我身无分文，不知所措，不知道下一步该做什么，”他说。 “我还有三个十几岁的孩子要抚养，而我的妻子只是一名临时工。我没有其他专长，前途一片黯淡。”

;

;余说他希望继续工作，因为他仍然身体健康，有能力继续做他所熟悉的事情。他最终成为了一名出租车司机，这份没有退休年龄的工作让他能够养家糊口。

;

;“像我这样没有良好教育和特殊技能的老年人没有太多选择，”现年 72 岁的于说。 “出租车司机是个体户，无论年龄大小，都能保证收入。越努力，挣得越多。”

;

;现在孩子们都长大了，他每个月工作三个星期，收入大约 10,000 港元（1,276 美元）。

;

;为什么香港人与“守旧派”老板就重返办公室展开拉锯战

;

;希望继续工作的香港年长者，尤其是那些受教育程度较低、选择不多的香港人，呼吁政府引入法定退休年龄以及老年人友好政策，以保障和促进 50 多岁、60 多岁及以上人群的就业。

;

;专家们认识到这样做的好处，因为该市正在努力应对因人才流失和劳动力短缺而变得更糟的人力短缺问题人口迅速老龄化。

;

;但一些人警告说，固定退休年龄可能会引发抵制，不仅来自雇主，还有那些更愿意提前停止工作的人。

;

;固定退休年龄“不容易” matter'

;

;由于没有法定退休年龄或法律强制要求老年人重新就业，香港落后于其他人口老龄化的社会，这些社会保护老年人的工作。

;

;英国的国家退休年龄为 66 岁，将在 2026 年至 2028 年期间分阶段提高至 67 岁，然后在 2044 年至 2046 年期间提高至 68 岁。

;

;在新加坡，法定退休年龄为 63 岁，雇主必须每年向 68 岁以下符合条件的员工提供再就业机会，只要他们愿意并且适合继续工作。

;

;日本公司必须确保 65 岁以下的员工就业，并提供大量补助金和向遵守规定的雇主提供补贴。

;

;“还有 4,500 天退休”：女性的“工作奴隶”日历显示中国正在改变的年轻人

;

;香港一直陷入关于是否退休的长期争论a statutory retirement age would bring more benefits than disadvantages by easing the labour shortage and helping to defuse social time-bombs such as the snowballing welfare price tag.

;

;The number of people aged 65 and above rose over the past 50 years from 180,000 in 1971 to 1.45 million in 2021.

;

;Over-65s currently account for one in five of the city's 7.33 million population and are projected to swell to more than one in four in 2028, and then to more than one in three in 2069.

;

;Hong Kong has been ranked No 1 worldwide for longevity and according to the World Bank, an infant born in the city in 2020 can expect to live to 85.4 years.< /p>;

;Last year, 499,500 people over 60 were still in the workforce, up from 161,200 in 2012.

;

;3,500 Hong Kong teachers quit, cashing out HK$10 billion from provident fund

;

;The city last year also suffered the biggest drop in its working population since records began in 1985, losing more than 94,000 employees, including many who left in a wave of emigration. The number who quit the labour force over the past four years totalled 220,500.

;

;Without a statutory retirement age, Hong Kong has left the private sector to decide for itself and it is mostly 60 to 65, with renewable contracts agreed by both sides.

;

;For government employees, the retirement age for recruits was extended from June 2015 to 65 for civilians and 60 for disciplined service officers, regardless of rank.

;

;The Mandatory Provident Fund (MPF), a compulsory pension fund to which employees and employers contribute, also serves as a reference. It allows full withdrawal of savings at age 65 except in certain circumstances.

;

;Women in Asia insecure about retirement, but fear investing is not for them

;

;Job support for the elderly has been limited too. The Labour Department's employment programme for middle-aged and older workers includes an on-the-job training allowance to encourage employers to hire this group.

;

;Employers who hire unemployed people aged 60 and older can receive up to HK$5,000 per month per eligible worker for six to 12 months. Since the allowance was raised in September 2020, more than 3,000 applications were approved as of March this year.

;

;Lawmaker Chau Siu-chung, of the Federation of Hong Kong and Kowloon Labour Unions, said the government should seriously consider introducing a statutory retirement age for the advantages it would bring.

;

;“As many of those aged 60 or above are still physically fit, the government should make use of this group in the labour force so they can continue to contribute to society,” he said, adding that the welfare burden would be eased if older people continued working.

;

;'Don't want to play mahjong': Chinese retiree says selling squid means happy life

;

;But he acknowledged that this was a complex issue requiring flexibility to meet the different expectations of employers and employees.

;

;“This is not an easy matter,” he said. “There is a social consensus that people can retire from the age of 60. What should be the appropriate age for retirement – 65? What about those who want to retire early? This is the question.”

;

;Chau said in deciding a statutory retirement age, the government should allow flexibility for employers and employees to agree on the terms.

;

;'Elderly prefer jobs, not handouts'

;

;Others, however, argued there was no need to impose a retirement age, and the government should leave the market to decide.

;

;Economist Simon Lee Siu-po, an honorary fellow at the Asia-Pacific Institute of Business at Chinese University, said a rigid official retirement age would make the employment of older people even worse.

;

;Preferring to leave things flexible, he said: “I ran into a grandma aged over 70 working in a McDonald's outlet and she was still in good shape and communicated well with her customers.

;

;“It shows that some companies have no problem hiring seniors who are willing to work. That's why there is no need to introduce a rigid law setting a retirement age. Just let the market dictate it.”

;

;Flexibility meant allowing people in some jobs or professions to work longer if there was a need.

;

;For example, he said, teachers at some public schools who were mandated to retire at 60 should have their retirement age extended as the education industry was facing a manpower crunch and badly needed experienced workers.

;

;Raising China's retirement ages won't 'make a big difference' in workforce size

;

;“The labour market should be operated on the basis of supply and demand. If the authorities impose a retirement age, this may backfire and cause many adverse effects as some people like to retire early,” he said.

;

;“It may become a legal weapon for the employers to stop their employment and import foreign labour.”

;

;Lee said it would be hard to arrive at the “right” retirement age. “Different professions have different demands and it's difficult to apply the same retirement yardstick to all sectors. This has to be carefully studied,” he said.

;

;Nelson Chow, emeritus professor at the University of Hong Kong's social work and social administration department, agreed, preferring employers to decide.

;

;“If the retirement age is extended to, say, 67, there may be repercussions and political implications as people may need to wait longer before they can get back their MPF,” he said.

;

;“The focus should not be whether there should be a statutory retirement age in Hong Kong. Rather, we should focus on facilitating employment of the elderly who are mostly not well educated and can only do unskilled work.”

;

;Chow and lawmaker Chau suggested that the government offer incentives to encourage employers to hire older workers, retraining programmes to help them switch to new jobs, and more part-time work opportunities.

;

;Chow said: “It is tough for the elderly to continue to work full time if it requires a lot of physical strength and hard labour. Part-time jobs will be more suitable for them.”

;

;A spokeswoman for the Labour and Welfare Bureau said the government had been trying to unleash the potential of middle-aged and older workers to meet changing manpower demands by providing retraining opportunities, holding career fairs and offering job-matching services.

;

;“The government will continue to review and enhance employment measures, taking into account the employment needs of the elderly and middle-aged persons,” she said.

;

;'Wish him a long life': octogenarian doctor works every day, rain or shine

;

;Sze Lai-shan, deputy director of the Society for Community Organisation, a non-governmental advocacy group helping the poor, said apart from creating more part-time jobs, the government could introduce community work with allowances to encourage older people to take part in social activities.

;

;She said one way would be to lower the threshold for the elderly to apply for the working family allowance like single parents, allowing them to work for a minimum of 36 hours a month to receive the basic allowance. Currently, they have to work 144 hours.

;

;“Not all old people are looking for handouts,” Sze said. “They take pride in going out to work and find spiritual sustenance from it.

;

;“By providing them less strenuous part-time jobs or community work, they can feel connected to society and have a source of motivation in life, instead of being stuck at home feeling old and useless.”

;

;Ho Ka-to, 73, who rents a bunk bed space in Yau Ma Tei for HK$1,600 a month, said he was in a state of distress after he had to retire at 65 from his job as a printing factory technician.

;

;Having no savings, he went from earning HK$14,000 a month to being penniless after using up his HK$50,000 pension funds.

;

;“I felt very agitated after retirement. I was always worried about having no money to feed myself,” he recalled.

;

;“I tried many jobs but nothing worked out. Security guard? I don't have computer knowledge. Warehouse worker? I am not physically fit. It was so hard for me to get a full-time job. This was the reality.”

;

;He now earns about HK$2,000 a month as a casual worker and receives a monthly elderly allowance of HK$4,000.

;

;Cabby Yu said he was thankful that driving a taxi allowed him to continue to make ends meet and support his family, or they would have faced destitution.

;

;“I really love to work and don't want to idle away my time,” he said. “Elderly people need a sense of meaning to carry on with life, otherwise they will wither away very soon from boredom.”

; Thu, 08 Jun 2023 09:20:02 +0800 In reforming Australia’s immigration policies, serious obstacles remainhttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3223099/reforming-australias-immigration-policies-serious-obstacles-remain?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.08 08:15;

;The Australian government of Anthony Albanese is currently working through a major restructure of its immigration policies. It is conducting a nationwide consultation, as Clare O'Neil, the federal minister in charge of migration, seeks to shape the recommendations of a major review that was initiated soon after she came to office in 2022.

;

;While the policy shifts are positive and seem genuinely to be moving towards a better, more efficient and humane migration system – including with regard to student and working visas – underlying historic concerns, largely beyond the reach of government, remain.

;

;Factors include a serious dearth of labour in certain sectors of the workforce, where positions can only be filled in the short to medium term by migrants. In 2022, there were 286 occupations experiencing a labour shortage, against 153 the year before. Sectors facing the worst shortages are nursing, elderly and child care, education, construction and engineering.

;

;The review committee's report was released in March and contains various recommendations. An outline published in April canvassing the proposed policy changes contained aspirational language around prioritising economic outcomes and building in sustainable systems.

;

;A further two policy shifts seek to dig into some deeper issues. The first is about “ensuring proper investment in housing, infrastructure and services to secure the benefits of migration”. Here, the government says: “We will also do more to assist migrants to achieve better labour market outcomes and we will do more to design out exploitation from the migration system.”

;

;The second aims to “focus on integrity measures to rid the system of abuse”. For potential long-term visitors and migrants thinking about coming to Australia, the inclusion of such agendas is encouraging, and the government's willingness to take a run at them is commendable.

;

;But issues like housing, infrastructure and services surrounding the migrant experience are monumental. These are areas with a multitude of moving parts, some of which do not have anything to do with immigration, and it is difficult to see how the identifiable problems in these areas can be fixed in the short term.

;

;What have the Chinese ever done for the Australians?

;

;The second policy shift raises even more complex issues, touching on Australia's long struggle with discrimination. It's well known that one of Australia's first legislative actions after becoming a federation in 1901 was the Immigration Restriction Act, otherwise known as the White Australia policy.

;

;This was designed to ensure the racial “purity” of the new nation. As prime minister John Curtin famously put it in the 1940s, “This country shall remain forever … an outpost of the British race.”

;

;Research published in 2022 by the Scanlon Foundation reported that one in four people born overseas said they were victims of discrimination in Australia in the 12-month period to mid-2022. One in three non-English speakers experienced discrimination in Australia in that same period.

;

;In 2016 and 2019, the Lowy Institute, an Australian think tank, surveyed Australians and found that the number of those who felt migrants were a burden on the social welfare system had increased from 40 per cent to 47 per cent of the population.

;

;In a similar vein, Lowy researchers found that those who disagreed with the premise that immigrants to Australia made the country stronger because of their hard work and talent grew from 25 per cent to 34 per cent.

;

;As such, even as the government tries to put out the welcome mat for a selection of long-term visitors and migrants, there will still be a sizeable minority who will be unhappy with those who have the temerity to step onto the mat.

;

;Those considering coming to Australia long term can be assured that, ultimately, the government and the law are on their side in matters of discrimination. But, for all our government's good efforts, Australia's history and culture will continue to colour the experience of many new arrivals. The work on that front is up to all Australians and, unfortunately, the research says we still have a long way to go.

;

;Visitors to Australia from Asia and elsewhere can also be part of the solution and they can rest assured that there remain plenty, like me, who will welcome those willing to give Australia a chance.

;Scientists have documented the first-known instance of a “virgin birth” by a crocodile, which had been living in isolation for 16 years at Costa Rican zoo, according to a study published Wednesday.

;

;The female American crocodile laid 14 eggs in 2018 within her enclosure, a not uncommon phenomenon among captive reptiles. The more puzzling fact, however, came after three months of incubation when one egg was found to contain a fully formed stillborn baby crocodile.

;

;According to the study published in the journal Biology Letters, scientists tested the crocodile fetus' genetic make-up. They found DNA sequences showing it was a result of facultative parthenogenesis (FP), or reproduction without the genetic contribution of males.

;

;The phenomenon of FP, which some scientists have referred to by the shorthand of “virgin birth”, has also been documented in other species of fish, birds, lizards and snakes. The scientists said this is the first-known example in a crocodile.

;

;In FP, a female's egg cell can develop into a baby without being fertilised by a male's sperm cell.

;

;In making an egg cell, a precursor cell divides into four cells: one becomes the egg cell and retains key cellular structures and the gel-like cytoplasm, while the others hold extra genetic material.

;

;Then, one of those cells essentially acts as a sperm cell and fuses with the egg to become “fertilised”.

;

;The American crocodile is considered vulnerable and at risk of extinction in the wild. According to one hypothesis, FP may be more common among species on the verge of extinction, the study said.

;

;

;The scientists said the Costa Rica “virgin birth” could lead to new information about crocodile ancestors that walked the earth in the Triassic Period some 250 million years ago.

;

;“This discovery offers tantalising insights into the possible reproductive capabilities of the extinct archosaurian relatives of crocodilians and birds, notably members of Pterosauria and Dinosauria,” the study said.
